data_structure.description: Comprehensive Spanish profanity database with regional variations and gender considerations

entry_format.variations: Common variations, gender forms, and obfuscations
entry_format.target_type: Whether it targets individuals, groups, or is general
entry_format.regions: Regions where this term is commonly used

words.context_notes: Universal Spanish profanity, equivalent to 'shit' in English
Very common in Spain, less offensive than English 'fuck'
Vulgar term for female genitalia, very offensive, especially in Latin America
Masculine form, can be homophobic slur, severity varies by region
Ranges from mild to offensive depending on region, can mean 'bastard' or be friendly
Mexican slang, can be homophobic, means 'asshole' literally and figuratively
Son of a whore, very offensive compound insult
Homophobic slur, extremely offensive to LGBTQ+ community
Argentine slang, can be friendly or insulting depending on context
Mexican verb with multiple meanings, from mild to very offensive
Vulgar term for penis, very common in Mexico and Central America
Common expletive, less offensive than English equivalents
Calling someone annoying or a 'sucker', sexual undertones
Spanish mild insult, literally 'cocoon' but slang for penis tip
Lesbian slur in Spanish, very offensive
Ethnic slur used in Spain against South Americans, very offensive
Context-dependent, can be neutral or offensive, varies greatly by region
Used as insult in Argentina, originally meaning 'Polish' but used against any immigrant
Chilean/Peruvian slang, can be friendly or insulting, very common
Colombian insult using STD name, moderately offensive
Go shit yourself, common dismissive phrase
Dick in Puerto Rico, bug elsewhere
Lesbian slur in Spain, very offensive
Argentine slang, can be friendly or insulting
Badass in Mexico, can be positive or negative
To fuck in Latin America, to take in Spain
Son of a bitch, combined form
Holy shit in Spain, religious profanity
Your mother's cunt, Argentina extreme insult
Faggot, can be friendly in Colombia but still offensive
Feminine form, ethnic slur in Argentina
Go to hell, go to shit
Dumbass in Chile, from huevón, can be friendly
Combined form of hijo de puta
To fuck oneself, go fuck yourself
I shit on, Spanish blasphemy phrase
I shit on God, extreme blasphemy
I shit on the milk, Spanish expression
I shit on the dead, very offensive

variations: me cag0 en tu puta madre
m cago en tu puta madre
words.context_notes: I shit on your whore mother, extreme
Holy shit in Spain, variant of hostia
May a fish fuck you, creative Spanish curse
Fuck you, may they fuck you
To the fucked place, Mexican expression
Fuck your mother, extreme Mexican insult
Dude in Mexico, can be insulting
Son of the fucked one, Mexican extreme
I don't give a fuck, Mexican

words.word: la concha bien de tu madre
variations: la concha bien d tu madre
la concha bien de tu mdr

words.context_notes: Cool or pussy, context-dependent in Colombia
Dude, idiot in Chile, variant spelling
Big shot, dealer in Puerto Rico
Dick owner, asshole in Central America

spain.notes: Generally more tolerant of sexual profanity, 'joder' is very common and mild

mexico.notes: Rich variety of creative insults, 'chingar' has many forms and meanings

argentina.notes: 'Boludo' can be friendly or insulting, Italian immigration influence

colombia.notes: Creative use of disease names as insults, varied by region

linguistic_patterns.gender_agreement: Most adjectives and nouns agree with gender (pendejo/pendeja)
linguistic_patterns.diminutives: Can soften or intensify meaning (cabroncito, putita)
linguistic_patterns.creative_compounds: Common to create new insults by combining words

english_speakers.english_confusion: Means 'to take' in Spain, sexual in Latin America
